name: Sheep MRI Brain Atlas
tagline: High Resolution Template and Low Resolution Template (with labels)
body:
### Sheep Brain MRI Atlas * High Resolution (7T) Template * Low Resolution (1.5T) Template * Low Resolution Labels * Automatic Segmentation Script ### MRI Template Details Low Resolution Sheep Atlas created using ANTS for template creation and ITK-SNAP for labeling. Subjects were 13 Adult Corriedale Ewe Brain MRIs. Labels are the Left and Right Motor Cortices, Ventricles, Thalamus, Hippocampus, Caudate and Amygdala. ### How to use this Atlas

The easiest method of utilising this atlas is to run the automatic segmentation script with the necessary arguments. The script utilises FSLs FLIRT and ANTS SyN Greedy Algorithm so both programs are required for the algorithm to work.

-

Alternatively, one can register the low resolution template to a subject to obtain a translation vector. The translation vector can be applied to the template labels to obtain translated labels.

### Reference ### Authors and Contributors Kishan A. Liyanage, Christopher Steward, Bradford A. Moffat, Nicholas L. Opie, Gil Rind, Sam John, Stephen Ronayne, Terence J. O’Brien, Marjorie E. Milne, Thomas J. Oxley Please address all correspondence to Kishan A. Liyanage (kishan.liyanage@gmail.com) ### Support or Contact Having trouble with Pages? Check out our [documentation](https://help.github.com/pages) or [contact support](https://github.com/contact) and we’ll help you sort it out.
